title: EU president Donald Tusk accuses Boris Johnson of playing 'stupid blame game’ and not wanting a deal
text:
The president of the European Council has accused Boris Johnson of playing a "stupid blame game" in Brexit talks and not really wanting a deal.

In an ill-tempered statement on Tuesday Donald Tusk accused the UK prime minister of failing to act in the best interests of the British public.

The intervention comes after a series of briefings from Downing Street overnight and through Tuesday portraying the EU as intransigent and suggesting talks are on the verge of collapse.

"Boris Johnson, what’s at stake is not winning some stupid blame game," he said in a post on social media on Tuesday afternoon.

"At stake is the future of Europe and the UK as well as the security and interests of our people. You don’t want a deal, you don’t want an extension, you don’t want to revoke, quo vadis?

Relations between the EU and Downing Street appear to have hit a new low after a No.10 source suggested negotiations were on the brink of collapse in Brussels.
